name: MOTS-C
aliases: Mitochondrial ORF of the 12S rRNA Type-C
overview: A mitochondrial-derived peptide that plays a role in metabolic regulation and cellular energy. It is a relatively new area of research exploring mitochondrial function and metabolic health.
who_should_avoid: severe cardiovascular disease without medical clearance
individuals with metabolic disorders without clinician guidance
interactions_notes: Limited interaction data available. Exercise caution with diabetes medications and metabolic therapies. Discuss all medications with a clinician.
dosing_ranges_literature: Emerging research has explored doses ranging from 5-15 mg administered 2-3 times per week. Human studies are limited and protocols vary.
storage_notes: Store unreconstituted peptide in freezer (-20Â°C or colder). After reconstitution with bacteriostatic water, store refrigerated and use within 2-3 weeks.

references.title: MOTS-c: A mitochondrial-encoded regulator of the nucleus
references.note: Initial discovery and characterization of MOTS-c peptide.

references.title: MOTS-c and metabolic homeostasis
references.note: Review of MOTS-c's role in metabolism and potential therapeutic applications.
